200.description: Provides RESTful services to manage jurisdictions. Jurisdictions are geographical regions or zones that represent a country, region, province, territory, or ZIP code range in which you sell goods.

id.description: The unique ID for the jurisdiction.

code.description: A code which, together with its storeId and subclass, uniquely identifies this jurisdiction.

storeId.description: The reference number of the store this jurisdiction associated with.

subclass.description: Indicates the jurisdiction types as follows: 1 = ShippingJurisdiction. 2 = TaxJurisdiction.

description.description: A brief description of the jurisdiction, suitable for display by a user interface that manages jurisdiction definitions.

country.description: The country or region.

countryAbbreviation.description: An optional ISO standard abbreviation code for the country or region.

state.description: The state, province, or other equivalent region.

stateAbbreviation.description: An optional country specific abbreviation code for the state or province.

city.description: The city or an equivalent.

zipcodeStart.description: The starting ZIP code or postal code of a range of ZIP codes or postal codes.

zipcodeEnd.description: The ending ZIP code or postal code of a range of ZIP codes or postal codes.

geoCode.description: A tax code that is based on geographic region. This code is used to support Taxware integration.

markForDelete.description: Indicates if this jurisdiction has been marked for deletion: 0 = No. 1 = Yes.

schema.description: Provides RESTful services to manage jurisdictions. Jurisdictions are geographical regions or zones that represent a country, region, province, territory, or ZIP code range in which you sell goods.

get.description: Get a collection of fulfillment centers.

parameters.name: searchString
parameters.description: Limits search results to only include fulfillment centers with a name that matches the value of this parameter. Searches are case-insensitive.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The fulfillment center ID.

parameters.name: memberId
parameters.description: The owning organization ID.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: A string that, along with the owner, uniquely identifies this fulfillment center.

parameters.name: defaultShipOffset
parameters.description: An estimate of the number seconds it takes for an item to be shipped from this fulfillment center.

parameters.name: markForDelete
parameters.description: Indicates whether the fulfillment center should be deleted as follows, 0 = do not delete. 1 = delete if no longer in use. Refer to the Database Cleanup utility.

parameters.name: externalFulfillmentStoreNumber
parameters.description: A reference number that can be used to locate a store or external fulfillment system.

parameters.name: inventoryOperationFlags
parameters.description: Contains bit flags indicating how to perform inventory operations. Enter an integer that is the sum of the number of the flags that you want to turn on. Example, Enter "3" to turn on flags 1 and 2. 1 = multiItem - operations accept multiple order items. 2 = noCheck - inventory is never checked (the check operation always appears to succeed). 4 = noAllocation - the allocate operation checks inventory, but does not actually allocate it (the allocate operation appears to succeed if the check succeeds). 8 = noBackorder - inventory is never backordered (the backorder operation always fails).

parameters.name: maxNumPick
parameters.description: The maximum number of the releases per pick batch.

parameters.name: pickDelayInMin
parameters.description: The delay in minutes from the time an order is placed until one of its releases can be included.

parameters.name: dropShip
parameters.description: Indicates whether the fulfillment center is a drop-ship fulfillment center. Y means that it is. N indicates that it is not.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The position within the resulting dataset where the query begins returning item records. If the offset is "5", the records that returned begin with the sixth record that matches the query parameters. If the offset is "0", the records that are returned begin with the first record that matches the query parameters.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of records to return.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: The comma-separated set of properties to be returned. If no properties are specified, all properties are returned.

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: The comma-separated set of related resources referenced in the links to be returned. If no related resources are specified, no related resources are returned.

For example, sort=name,-d which means, order the items based on the name value in ascending order, then by the id value in descending order.

get.description: Get a collection of Calculation Rule.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The calculation rule ID.

parameters.name: combination
parameters.description: Specify the bit flag to determine how this calculation rule can be combined with other calculation rules, 0 = The rule can be combined with any other rule. 1 = The rule can only be combined with rules that have the combination type 0 rules. 2 = The rule cannot be combined with rules that have the combination type 1.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: The time this calculation rule stops being effective. This is a SQL TIMESTAMP value. You can specify a null value. If you do not specify a value, the default value is 9999-12-31 23 59 59.0, which means that the calculation code never expires.

parameters.name: sequence
parameters.description: Calculation rules for the same calculation code are processed in sequence from lowest to highest value.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: The time this calculation rule begins being effective. This is a SQL TIMESTAMP value formatted as, YYYY-MM-DD HH MM SS.ff.

parameters.name: taxCategoryId
parameters.description: For TaxType CalculationUsages, the TaxCategory for which this CalculationRule is effective.

parameters.name: field1
parameters.description: Customizable.

parameters.name: field2
parameters.description: Customizable.

parameters.name: flags
parameters.description: Use to determine how this calculation rule may be combined with other calculation rules. Contains the following bit flag indicating special processing to be performed by the defaulti implementation, 1 = restricted - certain conditions must be met before the calculation rule qualifies. If this flag is not 1, then the calculation rule always qualifies. Example 1, For discount calculation rules, the customer must be in one of the associated member groups recognized by the Store as customer groups. Example 2, For shipping calculation rules, the shipping address, shipping mode and fulfillment center must match one of the shipping jurisdiction group calculation rules. Example 3, For tax calculation rules the shipping address and fulfillment center must match one of the tax jurisdiction group calculation rules.

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: Uniquely identifies this Calculation Rule, along with its Calculation Code.

parameters.name: calculationCodeId
parameters.description: The calculationCodeId of which this calculation rule is a part. You can get all the calculation codes by calling, /store/{storeId}/calculation-codes

parameters.name: calculationMethodId
parameters.description: The calculationMethodId calculates a monetary result for a set of order items.

parameters.name: calculationRuleQualifyMethodId
parameters.description: The CalculationRuleQualifyMethod that determines which of a set of OrderItems should be sent to the CalculationRuleCalculateMethod.

parameters.description: The position within the resulting dataset where the query begins returning item records. parameters.name: CalculationRule
parameters.description: A calculation rule defines how to arrive at a monetary amount for a set of order items.

id.description: The calculation rule ID.

combination.description: Specify the bit flag to determine how this calculation rule can be combined with other calculation rules, 0 = The rule can be combined with any other rule. 1 = The rule can only be combined with rules that have the combination type 0 rules. 2 = The rule cannot be combined with rules that have the combination type 1.

endDate.description: The time this calculation rule stops being effective. This is a SQL TIMESTAMP value. You can specify a null value. If you do not specify a value, the default value is 9999-12-31 23 59 59.0, which means that the calculation code never expires.

sequence.description: Calculation rules for the same calculation code are processed in sequence from lowest to highest value.

startDate.description: The time this calculation rule begins being effective. This is a SQL TIMESTAMP value formatted as, YYYY-MM-DD HH MM SS.ff.

taxCategoryId.description: For TaxType CalculationUsages, the TaxCategory for which this CalculationRule is effective.

flags.description: Use to determine how this calculation rule may be combined with other calculation rules. Contains the following bit flag indicating special processing to be performed by the defaulti implementation, 1 = restricted - certain conditions must be met before the calculation rule qualifies. If this flag is not 1, then the calculation rule always qualifies. Example 1, For discount calculation rules, the customer must be in one of the associated member groups recognized by the Store as customer groups. Example 2, For shipping calculation rules, the shipping address, shipping mode and fulfillment center must match one of the shipping jurisdiction group calculation rules. Example 3, For tax calculation rules the shipping address and fulfillment center must match one of the tax jurisdiction group calculation rules.

identifier.description: Uniquely identifies this Calculation Rule, along with its Calculation Code.

calculationCodeId.description: The calculationCodeId of which this calculation rule is a part. You can get all the calculation codes by calling, /store/{storeId}/calculation-codes

calculationMethodId.description: The calculationMethodId calculates a monetary result for a set of order items.

calculationRuleQualifyMethodId.description: The CalculationRuleQualifyMethod that determines which of a set of OrderItems should be sent to the CalculationRuleCalculateMethod.

schema.description: A calculation rule defines how to arrive at a monetary amount for a set of order items.

cumulative.description: Valid values, 0 = only the matching Calculation Range with the highest RANGE START value is used. 1 = all matching Calculation Ranges are used. The calculated monetary amounts are summed to arrive at the final result.

rangeStart.description: If a lookup number is greater than or equal to RANGE START, or if RANGE START is NULL, this row matches the lookup number.

markForDelete.description: Reserved for HCL Internal use.

calculationMethodId.description: The Calculation Range Method that determines a monetary amount from the Calculation Range Lookup Result.

calculationScaleId.description: The Calculation Scale of which this Calculation Range is a part.

parameters.description: The comma-separated set of properties which controls the order of the items being listed, prefixed by either (-) to sort by descending order, or optionally (+) to sort by ascending order. get.description: Get a collection of calculation codes.

parameters.name: searchString
parameters.description: Limits search results to only include calculation codes with a calculationCode that matches the value of this parameter. Searches are case-insensitive.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique numeric ID for identifying the calculation Code.

parameters.name: calculationCode
parameters.description: The external identifier or name for identifying the calculation code, given a particular calculation usage and store ID.

parameters.name: combination
parameters.description: Specify the bit flag to determine how this calculation rule can be combined with other calculation rules, 0 = The rule can be combined with any other rule. 1 = The rule can only be combined with rules that have the combination type 0 rules. 2 = The rule cannot be combined with rules that have the combination type 1.

parameters.name: groupBy
parameters.description: A Bit flag to indicate how the calculation method groups order items when performing calculations. Each group of order itmes is used to calculate a monetary amount, which is applied separately. The default calculation method recognizes the following groupings, 1 by product - Order items with different catalog entries should be grouped separately. When a catalog entry has a parent catalog entry, then the parent catalog entry is used instead. 2 by trading agreement - Order items with different trading agreements should be grouped separately. 4 by offer - Order items with different Offers should be grouped separately. 8 by address - Order items with different shipping addresses should be grouped separately. Bit flags can be added together to combine groupings. For example, 0 = No grouping. Place all applicable order items in a single group. 1 = Use for product grouping. 2 = Use for trading agreement grouping. 3 = Use for product and for trading agreement grouping. 4 = Use for offer grouping. 6 = Use for offer and for trading agreement grouping. 9 = Use for product and for address grouping.

parameters.name: published
parameters.description: Specifies whether or not the calculation code is published, 0 = not published (temporarily disabled). 1 = published.

parameters.name: sequence
parameters.description: When multiple calculation codes with the same calculation usage are processed, they are processed in ascending order based on the numeric values of this property.

parameters.name: storeId
parameters.description: The store ID this calculation code is associated with.

parameters.name: taxCodeClassId
parameters.description: If this calculation code is used to calculate taxes, then it can be grouped together with other tax calculation codes into a tax code classification. When the calculation code is used for shipping, this value can be null.

parameters.name: updatedDate
parameters.description: The time this calculation code was most recently updated.

parameters.name: field1
parameters.description: A customizable field.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: A brief description of this calculation code, suitable for display by a user interface that manages calculation codes.

parameters.name: displayLevel
parameters.description: Amounts calculated by this calculation code should be displayed with each, 0 = OrderItem, 1 = Order, 2 = Product, 3 = Item, 4 = Contract.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: The date and time this calculation code begins being effective.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: The date and time this calculation code stops being effective.

parameters.name: precedence
parameters.description: Reserved for HCL Internal use.

parameters.name: calculationUsageId
parameters.description: default is, -2. The calculation usage identifier. Indicates the kind of calculation this calculation code is used for. For example, the calculation code may be used to calculate one of the following monetary amounts, discounts, shipping charges, sales tax, or shipping tax. Out of box, -1 is for Discount, -2 is for Shipping, -3 is for Sales Tax. -4 is for Shipping Tax, -5 is for Coupon and -6 is for surcharge. For shipping always use the value -2.

parameters.name: calculationMethodId
parameters.description: default is, -23. The calculation code calculate method that defines how to calculate a monetary amount for this calculation code. For shipping, the calculation method ID must be -23.

parameters.name: calculationCodeApplyMethodId
parameters.description: default is, -24. The calculation code apply method that stores the calculated amount for the associated order items. For shipping, the calculation code apply method ID must be -24.

parameters.name: calculationCodeQualifyMethodId
parameters.description: default is, -22. The calculation code qualify method that defines which order items are associated with this valculation code. For shipping, the calculation code qualify methodID must be -22.

parameters.name: calculationCodeQualifyMethodMode
parameters.description: The mode which controls whether the qualify calculation method ID (calculationCodeQualifyMethodId) of this calculation code should be invoked. Allowed values are, 0 = unrestricted, the method will not be invoked, and 1 = restricted, the method will be invoked. Default is 0.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The position within the resulting dataset where the query begins returning item records. If the offset is "5", the records that returned begin with the sixth record that matches the query parameters. If the offset is "0", the records that are returned begin with the first record that matches the query parameters.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of records to return.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: The comma-separated set of properties to be returned. If no properties are specified, all properties are returned.

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: The comma-separated set of related resources referenced in the links to be returned. If no related resources are specified, no related resources are returned.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: The comma-separated set of properties which controls the order of the items being listed, prefixed by either (-) to sort by descending order, or optionally (+) to sort by ascending order. For example, sort=name,-d which means, order the items based on the name value in ascending order, then by the id value in descending order.

parameters.name: storeId
parameters.description: The store ID.

parameters.name: fulfillmentCenterId
parameters.description: The FulfillmentCenter ID.

parameters.name: shippingModeId
parameters.description: The ShippingMode. NULL indicates this shipping arrangement can be used regardless of shipping mode.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: The time this shipping arrangement starts being effective. If STARTDATE is NULL, it means it begin effective from the beginning.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: The time this shipping arrangement stops being effective. If ENDDATE is NULL, it means it will effective forever once it has been started. If the EndDate expires, this shipping arrangement turns invalid and then shoppers could not add items to the cart with this shipping arrangement.

parameters.name: trackingNumber
parameters.description: The tracking number.

parameters.name: field1
parameters.description: Customizable.

parameters.name: precedence
parameters.description: When more than one shipping arrangement (for the same Store and shipping mode) is effective at a particular time, the one with the highest precedence is used.

parameters.name: field2
parameters.description: Customizable.

parameters.name: flags
parameters.description: The low order bit contains a flag as follows, 1 - restricted = If this flag is 1, then this shipping arrangement applies only to order items whose shipping Addresses match one of the shipping jurisdiction associated with this shipping arrangement. Otherwise, it applies to all order items.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The position within the resulting dataset where the query begins returning item records. If the offset is "5", the records that returned begin with the sixth record that matches the query parameters. If the offset is "0", the records that are returned begin with the first record that matches the query parameters.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of records to return.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: The comma-separated set of properties to be returned. If no properties are specified, all properties are returned.

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: The comma-separated set of related resources referenced in the links to be returned. If no related resources are specified, no related resources are returned.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: The comma-separated set of properties which controls the order of the items being listed, prefixed by either (-) to sort by descending order, or optionally (+) to sort by ascending order. For example, sort=name,-d which means, order the items based on the name value in ascending order, then by the id value in descending order.
